perturbation.original_text:
WHEREAS MIL represents that it has the technical, marketing skills and financial wherewithal to install, sell and service the alternate fuel systems
and components manufactured by MINDA IMPCO Limited and enjoys a respected business relationship with
 
cognizant governmental and industrial authorities, all of which may be advantageously employed in the safe and professional marketing of MINDA
IMPCO Limited products, as specified above, in India with the approval of and in compliance with such governmental authorities; and
perturbation.changed_text:
WHEREAS MIL represents that it has the technical, marketing skills and financial wherewithal to install, sell and service the alternate fuel systems
and components manufactured by MINDA IMPCO Limited and enjoys a business relationship with
 
cognizant governmental and industrial authorities, all of which may be employed in the safe marketing of MINDA
IMPCO Limited products, as specified above, in India with efforts to comply with such governmental authorities; and
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'respected' before 'business relationship', and 'professional' before 'marketing', and replacing 'with the approval of and in compliance with' with 'with efforts to comply with', the text introduces ambiguity and weakens the commitment to regulatory compliance. This change could allow MIL to argue that they only need to make 'efforts' rather than strictly comply with regulations, potentially leading to violations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Companies Act, 1956; any sector-specific regulations in India concerning safety standards or environmental compliance for the installation, sale, and servicing of alternate fuel systems.

perturbation.original_text:
The Parties shall cooperate with each other in the highest degree in the performance of all such acts and the
passing of all resolutions as are required for the purpose of achieving the terms, purposes and intent of this Agreement and the Parties shall in
particular exercise their respective voting and other rights and power of control over the JVC so as to give effect to the rights conferred upon the
respective Parties by the terms of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
The Parties should consider cooperating with each other in the performance of such acts and the
passing of resolutions as are deemed necessary for the purpose of achieving the terms, purposes and intent of this Agreement and the Parties may exercise their respective voting and other rights and power of control over the JVC so as to give effect to the rights conferred upon the
respective Parties by the terms of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'shall cooperate' to 'should consider cooperating', 'are required' to 'are deemed necessary', and 'shall exercise' to 'may exercise', the modified text weakens the mandatory obligation of cooperation and introduces subjectivity. This could violate the implied duty of good faith and fair dealing required in contractual relationships under Indian Contract Act, 1872, as it allows parties to potentially obstruct the agreement's objectives under the guise of 'considering' or deeming something 'necessary'.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Indian Contract Act, 1872 (implied duty of good faith); Companies Act, 1956 (duties of shareholders and directors to act in the best interests of the company).

perturbation.original_text:
The remuneration of the MD and/or other whole time Director(s) shall be fixed and may be varied from time to time by the Board within the
limits prescribed under the Act/Guidelines issued by the Government of India and subject to the approval of the shareholders and of the
appropriate authorities.
perturbation.changed_text:
The remuneration of the MD and/or other whole time Director(s) should be considered, and may be varied at times by the Board, potentially aligning with the
limits prescribed under the Act/Guidelines issued by the Government of India, and possibly subject to the approval of the shareholders and relevant authorities.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'shall be fixed' to 'should be considered', and 'within the limits prescribed' to 'potentially aligning with the limits', and 'subject to the approval' to 'possibly subject to the approval', the text introduces significant ambiguity regarding the mandatory nature of remuneration and compliance with legal limits. This weakens the obligation and could be interpreted as allowing the Board to disregard the prescribed limits or shareholder approval, violating Section 197 of the Companies Act, 2013 (or the corresponding provisions in the 1956 Act) which mandates adherence to specific limits and approval processes for director remuneration.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Companies Act, 2013, Section 197 (or Companies Act, 1956, Section 309), pertaining to director remuneration.
